intro: Plagiobothrys borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean plagiobothrys, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically appear in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with stipules, and its fruit is a legume pod containing several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
